info.description:
The Avetta API is a mechanism to allow our customers to retrieve Audit and Supplier data from Connect via application programming interface. The Avetta API is organized around REST and uses HTTP status codes and error payload responses to indicate API errors.

We leverage the HTTP protocol features, like HTTP verbs and status codes, which are commonly used and are understood by off-the-shelf HTTP clients.
All API responses (including errors) will be returned in JSON format.

#### Versioning <- IMPORTANT UPDATE MUST READ ->

You will notice in this documentation that the URL for this API is as follows: https://api.avetta.com/client-api/vX....
This URL contains `vX` to specify the particular version to be used when making the desired call. Different versions of the same endpoint may return different results, therefore it is important to note the versions of each endpoint in this documentation.
Please be aware of this as you check each endpoint.

#### Authentication

When using the API, include your secret API key in the request for the service to authenticate your account. This API Key will be provided to you by your point of contact in Avetta.

All API requests must be made over HTTPS. Calls to the service over HTTP will result in a 302 Redirect response to the HTTPS end-point. API requests without an apikey will fail.

#### Errors

Avetta uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request. In general, codes in the 2xx range indicate success, codes in the 4xx range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, an invalid account number, validation failure, etc.), and in rare situations, codes in the 5xx range indicate a server error.

#### Pagination

Avetta has a default maximum limit of 3000 results in one API call. In the case where the response returns more than the default limit, you must utilize pagination to retrieve the full data set. Avetta utilizes cursor-based pagination via optional start and limit query string parameters.
The start indicates the record to start with for pagination and the limit indicates the total number of records to return (maximum of 3000).

#### Modified Records

An optional parameter available for both supplier and audit endpoints is the `modifiedAfter` field. This query string parameter takes in a string with the following format: `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss` using Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). This will return records that have been modified after the specified date and time. In the event that only a date, `yyyy-MM-dd`, is received the system will default the time to `00:00:00` UTC.


#### Error Handling

Our errors are listed below in the following format -> Code Error Number [Actual Message]: Description of the error.
* Code 1 [Validation Failed]: An invalid API key was provided.
* Code 2 [Invalid Parameters]: The start and/or limit parameters entered are not within acceptable limits.
* Code 3 [Unknown Record]: The entered start parameter is beyond the total number of records available.
* Code 4 [Unmapped]: Client ID that is entered is not mapped on the custom DB tables.
* Code 5 [Server Error]: The system has encountered an unexpected error while processing the request.
* Code 6 [ConID Error]: The requested supplier ID is unknown under the current API key.
* Code 7 [Null Data]: No audit or flag data available.
* Code 8 [Invalid Format]: Provided date and time does not conform to the `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss` or `yyyy-MM-dd` formats.
* Code 9 [Unknown file type]: Internal Server Error.
info.title: Client API Service Exisiting

get.description: Retrieves a set of `Audit` data based on the client making the request and the pagination parameters. The `href` field will only return for `Audit` data that are file related. Only active suppliers that have approved connections to clients will be returned in this endpoint.

parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: Contractor ID to determine total records per contractor
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Optional value to return amount of modified records since the specified date and time
parameters.name: modifiedAfter

parameters.description: The ID of the file
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The apikey for the client
parameters.name: apikey

get.description:
Return the binary file. The response content type header is set to be a PDF as an example, but other file types can be returned such as text, or doc/docx.
The URL for this endpoint is returned by the `href` field from the `Audit Data` endpoint. That `href` field will require an additional `&apikey=INSERT_API_KEY_HERE` to be appended to the end of the URL for a valid file call to be made.

get.description: Retrieves a set of `Insurance` data based on the provided apiKey and pagination parameters. If an `id` is provided, only the insurance data pertaining to that supplier will be returned. Only active suppliers that have approved connections to clients will be returned in this endpoint.

parameters.description: The apikey for the client
parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: The record to start with for pagination (1-based, not 0-based)
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: The total number of records to return, maximum of 3000
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Optional value to provide which will restrict records to only return those with an updatedDate after the modified after date. Any value under the supplier which changes includes tags, flags, reasons that was modified will trigger the updated date.
parameters.name: modifiedAfter

get.description:
Retrieves a list of multiple supplier data. Only active suppliers that have BOTH approved connections to clients AND have flags will be returned in this endpoint.

* The `flags` array contains the supplierâ€™s flag for a particular `client_id`. 
* The `client_id` field is the identifier of a specific site within your account hierarchy. 
* The `system_flag` field shows the overall flag color for a particular supplier/contractor for that `client_id`.
* The `system_flag_details` array contains the detail of your individual flaggable data and its current flag color. This provides specific detailed reasons for the current overall flag color, `system_flag` for in regards to that specific `client_id`.

parameters.description: The apikey for the client
parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: Optional value to return amount of modified records since the specified date and time
parameters.name: modifiedAfter

parameters.description: The numeric identifier for a supplier
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The apikey for the client
parameters.name: apikey

get.description: Retrieves information about the provided supplier ignoring `start`, `limit`, and `modifiedAfter` parameters.

Retrieves the dateTime value (in UTC) of the last Avetta ETL run for the provided `endpoint`. This dateTime field will differ depending on the provided `endpoint` field. Current valid `endpoint` values are `suppliers` and `audits`.

parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: The desired endpoint to retrieve the ETL finish date for.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: The apikey for the client

get.description:
Retrieves a list of criteria flag data based on the provided apikey. The `flagDetails` object contains information relevant to the type of flag returned. For example, a `flagType` of `account` will have no `formId` or `questionId` values (will default to `""`) since an account level flag does not relate to a specific form/question. Likewise a `flagType` of `question` will have both `formId` and `questionId` populated as a question level flag pertains to a specific question in a specific form.

Only active suppliers that have with approved connections to clients will be returned in this endpoint. 

This endpoint does not retrieve the overall flag status between a supplier and a client, which will be returned in the "Connections" endpoint.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: The apikey for the client

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The record to start with for pagination (1-based, not 0-based)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The total number of records to return, maximum of 3000

parameters.name: modifiedAfter
parameters.description: Optional value to provide which will restrict records to only return those with an flagUpdatedDate after the modified after date.

get.description:
Retrieves a list of connections based on the provided apikey. 
This endpoint retrieves the overall flag status between a supplier and a client.

get.description:
Updated version of the `Audit` endpoint which uses updated nomenclature and includes the applicable client sites a particular form is valid for.

Retrieves a set of `Form` data based on the provided request/pagination parameters. 
The `href` field in the schema below will only return for `Form` data where the question requires a file upload as an answer. 
Only active suppliers that have approved connections to clients will be returned in this endpoint.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: The apikey for the client

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The record to start with for pagination (1-based, not 0-based)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The total number of records to return, maximum of 3000

parameters.name: supplierId
parameters.description: Optional filter for a supplier

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Optional filter for a client account

parameters.name: formId
parameters.description: Optional filter for a specific form

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: Optional filter for a form year

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: Optional filter for a category

parameters.name: questionId
parameters.description: Optional filter for a question

parameters.name: modifiedAfter
parameters.description: Optional value to return records after the specified date and time

get.description: Returns the total number of records from the `Form` Endpoint. All query parameters from the `Form` endpoint are also applicable in this endpoint as those values will be used in determining the number of records given the provided parameters.

tags.description:
Our errors are listed below in the following format -> Code Error Number [Actual Message]: Description of the error.

Code 1 [Validation Failed]: An invalid API key was provided.

Code 2 [Invalid Parameters]: The start and/or limit parameters entered are not within acceptable limits.

Code 3 [Unknown Record]: The entered start parameter is beyond the total number of records available.

Code 4 [Unmapped]: Client ID that is entered is not mapped on the custom DB tables.

Code 5 [Server Error]: The system has encountered an unexpected error while processing the request.

Code 6 [ConID Error]: The requested supplier ID is unknown under the current API key.

Code 7 [Null Data]: No audit or flag data available.

Code 8 [Invalid Format]: Provided date and time does not conform to the `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss` or `yyyy-MM-dd` formats

Code 9 [Unknown file type]: Internal Server Error
